ResearchTabDef.generalDescription: Nara Industries spread technology to every planet they occupied, forcing native residents to complete a selection process to determine their compatability with their technology. Nara never stopped pursuing technological advancements during their operations. \n\nSome people say that the colonial fleets are several groups of industrial complexes controlled by AIs whom capable of interstellar traveling between galaxies.

ResearchProjectDef.label: Automatroid Basis
ResearchProjectDef.description: Automatroids are weapons capable of independent thought used to destroy their adversaries without human input. \n\nThese morally ambigious machines became common place as replacements for front-line infantrymen due to their lack of value for human life.

ResearchProjectDef.label: Neural Prosthesis
ResearchProjectDef.description: Neural prosthetics designed for disabled soldiers. They're durable and easily adapted to, requiring minimal training for the patient to become comfortable. However, due to the natural wear and tear of its mechanical components, these prosthetic replacements are not as efficient as their original flesh counterparts.

ResearchProjectDef.label: Dead Man's Switch
ResearchProjectDef.description:
The Dead Man's Switch is a failsafe mechanism intended to induce a self-destruct sequence in connected mechs when the operator becomes incapacitated. 

Researchers realized this failsafe mechanism made artificial intelligence understand the meaning of death and self preservation, which had significant ramifications for humanity.

Unlocks the ability to construct Decoy Antennas which will attract a group of rogue automatroids to the transponder.
ResearchProjectDef.discoveredLetterText: Some advanced automatroids require specific parts which are only manufactured in low gravity environments.\n\nColonial High Command turns a blind eye to attracting and destroying their rogue automatroids which will contain the components required for further progression.

ResearchProjectDef.label: Artificial Muscle
ResearchProjectDef.description: Artifuscle is a type of prosthetic material made from genetically enhanced lab grown muscle-fiber bundles. Artifuscle made its rounds in military and civilian markets, and it didn't take long for military developers to realize the future of mechanical-biological hybrid weapons.

ResearchProjectDef.label: Pioneer Equipment
ResearchProjectDef.description: Uniforms and equipment designed for humans, mainly for civilian use and emergency survival situations. Includes basic uniforms and firearms typically handled by militamen and colonists alike.

ResearchProjectDef.label: Cluster Transceiver
ResearchProjectDef.description: Cluster transceivers are a way to control robots in a battlespace. Mechanical units that have obtained self-awareness as a result of a Dead Man Switch have been noted to resist directives provided by these transceivers.

ResearchProjectDef.label: Defense Equipment
ResearchProjectDef.description: Equipment designed for humans and automatroids. Its a step above the survivalist equipment Pioneers are issued with better tolerances and quality in its designs. This equipment is better suited for defensive operations due to its limited range.

ResearchProjectDef.label: Military Equipment
ResearchProjectDef.description: This equipment is primarily designed for automatroid use, as its too heavy to operate by an unaugemented human. It consists of heavy weapons and breaching tools as well as high caliber defense platforms.

ResearchProjectDef.label: Heavy Weaponry
ResearchProjectDef.description: Heavy duty firepower designed for the largest of automatroids. This gear is too heavy to be operated by smaller automatroid units and consists of fire supremacy solutions sure to turn the tide of any war they're introduced to. Includes high caliber autocannons, anti-tank guns, and defense platforms.

ResearchProjectDef.label: Battle Friends
ResearchProjectDef.description: Due to a clerical ereror, its undetermined if the proper term for these machines is "battle frames" or "battle friends"- They're automatroids outfitted with exoskeleton frames which are customizable to fit the needs of the operator. They are useful in combat and in the mundane operations of day to day colony life.

ResearchProjectDef.label: Hybird Engineering
ResearchProjectDef.description: The establishment of biological-mechanical hybrid technology during World War III saw independent mercenaries establish create a sovereign state with personnel using drones and hybrid prosthetics. Their forces consisted of discared wounded veterans who returned to fight for their cause due to the advances in biomechanical engineering and prothesis. They also developed a munition that rendered the advanced charged ammuniton of the worlds' armies inert.\n\nAfter their eventual slaughter, their creation of a Blaster Screen Shell remained as their only legacy.

ResearchProjectDef.label: Biosynthetic Prosthetics
ResearchProjectDef.description: With the advances in robotic and bionic engineering, biological-mechanical hybrid technology has became feasible. Unlocks biosynthetic arms and legs, as well as the serum required to aid in the body accepting such a replacement.

ResearchProjectDef.label: Organ Replacement
ResearchProjectDef.description: Unlocks the creation of Nutrition Ports and Sensory Filters which allow for the dulling of emotional feelings and a streamlining of the nutritional intake process. While these are certainly more efficient than their organic counterpart, what is lost forever in the pursuit of ultimate efficiency?

ResearchProjectDef.label: Wetware Hypothesis
ResearchProjectDef.description: After the discovery of the Dead Man's Switch, an AI algorithm engineer proposed a hypothetical solution to the halting problem caused by a loss of directional control of the automatroids. \n\n Wetware was created as a proof of concept, serving as an organic brain activated in a series with the Dead Man's Switch enabling Automatroids to awaken and continue fighting after their operator has died. Preliminary tests indicated a portion of the operator's personality was transposed into the Automatroid- but such reports dissapeared as quickly as they were made. Allows for the construction of Decoy Radars and heavier Automatroids, as well as the synthesis of Wetware Computers.

ResearchProjectDef.label: Heavy Automatroid
ResearchProjectDef.description: These massive machines were purpose built for full-scale warfare amongst nations. Unlocks various assault Automatroids which took inspiration from old-war vehicles and technology, but with a modernized twist.

ResearchProjectDef.label: Humanoid Engineering
ResearchProjectDef.description: During the early wars, Automatroids with human shapes were shown to be effective at demoralizing human combatants and inflicting psychological trauma upon enemies lines. This lead to the development of a series of Automatroids deemed the Arquebusier Models.

ResearchProjectDef.label: Peacekeepers
ResearchProjectDef.description: A series of Arquebusier model Automatroids designed for urban warfare, these models boast heavy armor, lightning fast mobility, and a punishing array of compatible weaponry. This line of Automatroids excel in urban environments and close quarters combat, but can also work as less lethal peacekeepers and riot control units.

ResearchProjectDef.label: Next-Gen Weaponry
ResearchProjectDef.description:
Weapons development centered around biomechanical hybrids continued until World War IV, where it had reached incomprehensible heights.\n\nThis was the beginning of the next-generation weapons that would ultimately lead to the destruction of the planet. Unlocks the Tarbosaurus, a fearsome predatory Automatroid shaped after the mighty carnotaurus capable of hosting enough firepower to destroy entire cities if left unchecked. 6000 Spacer
